item.title: Publications
item.description: Selected Publications Full List | DBLP| Academic Countdown Learning to Attack Distributionally Robust Federated Learning. W. Shen, H. Li, and Z. Zheng; NeurIPS 2020 Workshop on Scalability, Privacy, and Security in Federated Learning (Best Paper Award Nominee) Spatial-Temporal Moving Target Defense: A Markov Stackelberg Game Model. H. Li, W. Shen, and Z. Zheng; AAMAS 2020 A Simulation Analysis of Large Contests with Thresholding Agents. W. Shen, R.

item.title: Research
item.description: Research Topics I am generally interested in multi-agent systems, reinforcement learning, and game theory. My research has been primarily driven by the following intriguing question: How can we design effective incentive mechanisms/information structures/learning algorithms to help stakeholders make quality decisions that are robust and resilient in the presence of uncertainty and strategic behavior? I believe solutions to this problem can help us gain insights into how to tackle some of the most pressing social challenges that include traffic congestion, climate change, epidemics, misinformation propagation and cyber attacks.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching Activities Mentor, Henger Li (Ph.D. candidate at Tulane), 2019 - ongoing Reader, ICS5 - Global Disruption and Information Technology, Spring 2019 Mentor, Pratik Shetty (M.S. at UCI, Now a software engineer at Microsoft), 2018 Reader, ICS45J - Programming In Java, Spring 2018 Assistant, INF295 - Distributed Interactive Simulation, Spring 2016 Reader, INF124 - Internet Applications Engineering, Spring 2015 Reader, INF225/CS221 - Information Retrieval, Winter 2015 Reader, INF43 - Introduction to Software Engineering, Fall 2014
